intro: Hibiscus sulfuranthus, commonly known as the sulfur-hued hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which contrast vividly with its dark green foliage. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known species like cotton and hibiscus. Hibiscus sulfuranthus thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its unique coloration makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
